title: Espresso
content: Espresso is a concentrated coffee made by forcing hot water through finely-ground coffee beans. It's the foundation of most coffee drinks and has a bold, rich flavor. A standard shot uses about 7g of coffee and yields 30ml of liquid.

title: Ristretto
content: A ristretto is a short shot of espresso, using the same amount of coffee but half the water, resulting in a more concentrated and sweeter flavor. It's perfect for those who prefer a stronger coffee taste.

title: Foamed Milk
content: Foamed milk is created by introducing air into milk using a steam wand, creating a light, frothy texture. This technique is essential for drinks like cappuccinos and macchiatos. The ideal foam should be velvety and hold its shape.

title: Steamed Milk
content: Steamed milk is heated and aerated using a steam wand to create a creamy, velvety texture. This technique is crucial for lattes and flat whites. The milk should reach about 150°F (65°C) for optimal sweetness and texture.
